content: प्लव {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [प्लु-अच्] {@--1@} Swimming, floating. {@--2@} Jumping, leaping. {@--3@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Superior, excellent. --वः {@--1@} Swimming, floating. {@--2@} Flood, swelling of a river. {@--3@} A jump, leap. {@--4@} A raft, float, canoe, small boat; नाशयेच्च शनैः पश्चात्प्लवं सलिलपूरवत् <ls>Pt. 2. 38</ls>; सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं संतरिष्यसि <ls>Bg. 4. 36</ls>; <ls>Ms. 4. 194</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">11. 19</ls>; <ls>Ve. 3. 25.</ls> {@--5@} A frog. {@--6@} A monkey. {@--7@} A declivity, slope. {@--8@} An enemy. {@--9@} A sheep. {@--10@} A man of a low tribe; a Cāṇḍāla. {@--11@} A net or snare for catching fish. {@--12@} The fig-tree. {@--13@} The Kāraṇḍava bird, a kind of duck. {@--14@} Five or more stanzas syntactically connected. (= कुलक <ab>q. v.</ab>) {@--15@} The prolated utterance of a vowel. {@--16@} Returning, return. {@--17@} Urging on, inciting.
